jobDescription: Independently and in collaboration with other analytical scientists, develop and evaluate analytical test methods for active pharmaceutical ingredients, intermediates and drug products in support of drug product development;Develop and evaluate tests for residual actives and cleansers in support of manufacturing cleaning validation;Use chemical and physical analytical techniques to support new formulations development, characterization, elucidation of degradation pathways, and impurity identification;Provide developed methods and approved method validation protocols to the pre-market stability group for execution;Execute analytical testing procedures for early prototypes, informal stability, process optimization, and any other testing required in support of new product development;Design, execute and interpret complex laboratory experiments in a fast-paced environment and enter test results into the LIMS database;Write analytical test methods, method development reports and method validation protocols;Review analytical data, troubleshoot experimental methods and performing analytical testing as required;Lead or participate in investigations;Generate accurate scientific analytical data;Review accuracy of scientific analytical data generated by other scientific professionals;Optimize existing processes or create well designed new processes to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the group;Perform any other activities/tasks as needed to support the department.Bachelor’s degree, or international equivalent, in Science with six (6) or more years of proven experience; orMaster’s degree, or international equivalent, in Science, with two (2) or more years of proven experience; orPh.D. degree, or international equivalent, in Science;Thorough knowledge of analytical instrumentation (i.e. HPLC, GC, AA, IR, UV-VIS) and wet chemical techniques with strong focus on HPLC problem-solving skills;Strong background in developing analytical procedures for various pharmaceutical dosage forms and will be capable of independently solving challenging analytical problems;In-depth understanding of GMP, HA and internal requirements;Strong working knowledge of various types of software including Word, Empower software and Excel spreadsheets;Ability to support experimentation and documentation in the preparation and revision of compendial monographs, IND, NDA submissions, and other technical matters involving regulatory agencies.Good communication and interpersonal skills;Highly motivated with a positive “can- do” attitude and the ability to work in a fast paced environment as a collaborative team member as well as an individual performer.
